Reviews.Title: “Going down!”
Reviews.Author: Analyzer65
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times and had a fairely good experience. The staff is not very friendly, but we'v had no trouble - until last time. We where three adults booked a tripple, and we got a tiny room (number 307)- luckily only one of us had a suitcase. We asked for another, as we know they have big ones. We where promised the day after. During the night my husband got badly stung from bedbugs. But the staff did not believe us. After showing them they said -" We HAD budbugs - but not now". They couln't give us a new room since it was full, and they couldn't get in contact with the manager since it was a weekend. I read that someone got a refund for the exactly same thing. We didn't - and moved to a another hotel. We where asked to contact the manager by our selves on monday. The staff couldn't and wouldn't do a thing. We have know tried to get in touch with the manager but have got now answer. They where rude and very little helpful. I will never stay there again - avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: julie s
Reviews.Content: i didnt expect a room in the basement, the view from the tiny window was of pigeons nesting in pipes, that had deficated everywhere, filthy. The sink in the bathroom was blocked and full of water. We called a member of staff who said he couldnt fix it and we should just let the sink overflow, we ended up brushing our teeth in the shower. Woke at 1.30am as the room was hot and humid and couldnt sleep, room was next to boiler. tried opening window but it had been nailed shut, radiators were off. rang reception for a fan and was told if i wanted one i had to get dressed and fetch it myself from reception. The room was tiny and the beds rocked when you moved, felt very unstable and uncomfortable to sleep in. The only good thing I can say about the hotel was that the breakfast was lovely as were the breakfast staff. Would never ever go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling triple room”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyC992
Reviews.Content: We felt conned! There were NO three single beds as the room description on the website stated. There was a double bed which had a lopsided worn out mattress. When you sleep, you could virtually feel the upper half of your body lying downwards at a -20 degrees angle. The other single 'bed' should not be called a bed in the traditional sense. It was a squeaky camp-bed with an extremely thin mattress that collapsed into the springs of the bed when you step on it. The room was also extremely small, there was no room for 3 of our small trolley bags. There was only one chair for three people to share and you could not walk around the room without bumping into others. Apart from the small room, it was an extremely stuffy room even with the window opened. The reception staff was also not very knowledgeable. We asked whether the spot right outside the hotel main entrance was a parking spot or not and he completely had no idea. Moreover, we found it strange that the reception takes the full payment of the hotel room the moment you checked in! First time I came across such a practice! The only redeeming quality about this hotel is the cleanliness of the hotel room and the ensuite toilet. Then again, the housekeeping staff would knock on your door on the day you check out to demand a '2 or 3 pounds tip' as she termed it. Definitely not a four star hotel, more like a two star! Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Better off with a Travelodge instead!”
Reviews.Author: Fay533
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and arrived at 10pm to a very rude and unhelpful man on reception. After being given no indication about where to find my room or what floor it was on, 6 floors later I found my room. Disappointing is an massive understatement! The bathroom was tiny, and the tap didn't work for the first 3 attempts, and when it did there were massive air locks constantly. Green bits of mold flaked off the tap when it was turned on. Technically there was a lot crammed in the room, unfortunately I could reach everything provided from my bed as it touched the walls on 3 sides. The steps were worn and potentially a falling hazard, further to this there was a large black cable running across the floor and under the bed which I couldn't unplug and kept falling over it. I didn't have breakfast but on reading other reviews, this seemed a wise choice. Recommend room 607 would serve better as a cupboard. There are plenty of other hotels in the area, which if you look through a price comparison site, are no more expensive. Do not stay at Duke of Leinster Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average Joe hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leticiaaa
Reviews.Content: I didnt hate nor love this hotel. Firstly, it's a 2 star hotel. Not very neat, not very nice. The facade is beautiful, the rooms on the other hand are very simple and not kept. Things looked old and worn out, but the bed was nice and we got no bugs in ours as other guests report in some reviews here. We got room 202 on the ground floor, close to the reception and it was not as noisy as I thought it would be. The hotel's location is quite ok, three blocks from the subway, some stores around, close to Hyde Park. The worst was the breakfast. This is a huge part of the traveling experience for me and the breakfast was totally boring and plain. Juice, bread, coffee, milk and yoghurt. Exactly what you expect from a 2 star hotel, not a 4. Free good speed wi fi by the way.

Reviews.Title: “never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: 0431Harrington
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place I have ever stayed in! On arriving by myself the people in the room next door were having a massive fight, the screaming was horrific I thought someone was being murdered! Went straight down stairs and told reception, they just shrugged their shoulders and did nothing! I was speaking to another guest and they suggested it may have been the staff! Anyway, asked for some milk for a cup of tea at about 5.00pm, they said no and that the kitchen was closed. The breakfast was horrid, the orange juice was watered down so much it didn't even taste like oranges. The matchbox size room was so hot and their was no air con, just a small fan the size of a dinner plate. The lights were not working when we arrived and had to wait for someone to come up and change the bulbs. All of this was so off putting, I would never recommend this place to anyone. It was nothing like the pictures I had seen of it and the staff were not friendly at all. The whole place was a complete rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly Average”
Reviews.Author: Lou568
Reviews.Content: The hotel was billed as a four star but I really cannot see how. I stayed in a double room on the first night which was so small, the bed was pushed against the wall, and we couldn't open the wardrobe door fully due to its close proximity to the bed. We couldn't actually walk around the bed properly - we had to sidestep. The bed was also extremely uncomfortable - knackered mattress. The bedroom was behind the reception and there was no separating door, so it was extremely noisy. Breakfast was served in a poky basement room, awful service, not enough tables for all of the guests, we weren't offered any cooked breakfast. On the second night I stayed in a twin room which was a decent size but some bright spark had turned the radiator up to max and it couldn't be turned down, so it was like a sauna. We asked for breakfast to be delivered to the room and - I kid you not - it arrived on a small tray in a brown paper bag, with the milk in paper cups. Classy. The only good point were the friendly reception staff, but aside from them I really wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: SilviaBrighton
Reviews.Content: It was with trepidation that we arrived at the hotel after reading all the terrible reviews about bed bugs etc. Our family, 2 adults & 2 teenage boys had booked in for an overnight stay. I must say how much better it was than I expected. We had room 202 with 2 single beds & 2 fold out beds that were just about OK for the boys for 1 night. After checking all the sheets for any signs of bugs I was relieved to find them spotlessly clean. The room was small but adequate with a TV & the usual tea, coffee & milk & a safe. The bathroom was small but clean with clean towels, good power shower & toiletries. The negatives were that it was noisy with street noise from the room we were in & noise from adjoining room & rooms above. It was also hot & stuffy with no AC. The breakfast was adequate but need to get there early as the room is small & people were waiting. The hotel is in a good area for tubes etc & right near Hyde park. Staff were friendly enough but don't expect 5 star treatment. All in all a better than expected stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carly H
Reviews.Content: I am a 20 something traveller who is used to staying in very average accomodation on a budget, however this hotel fell significantly below my expectations. My main issue is with bed bugs. Within an hour of arriving we found 2 bed bugs in the bed linen. We took a photo and put the bugs in a glass to show the reception staff. Having gone to reception and explained that there were bed bugs in the linen which was not acceptable we were asked "what do you want us to do about that?". When I suggested they give us a new room they refused. When I suggested they at least change the bedding I was told they wouldn't because the maid wasn't in that day and we would have to sleep in the bedding that was in the room. I even offered to change the beds myself if they gave me the fresh linen but was told they "didn't know if there was any". Eventually we demanded a refund and left to stay at a different hotel just over the road (called the holiday villa hotel, same priced rooms, a little more dated but friendly staff and clean beds. I would fully recommend this as a far superior alternative!) Other more minor points: As with other reviews the rooms are basically all double/ single rooms with 1/2 additional dodgy camp beds shoved in wherever they will fit, often blocking ability to use dressing tables/ cupboards.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Al Ain, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel with bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leonnardo M
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel was an unpleasant surprise. I saw the room on website, it was spacious, nice and clean. The lift was the first surprise: very small, noisily, stopped to work during the stay... Then we were led to the room. It wasn't the same. Was too small for 2 people, imagine for 4. After the first night, we woke up with my sister-in-law thinking her nose bleeding, but when she turned on the lights we saw many bed bugs... We went to London to see our newborn niece and we were too afraid of spread the bugs of my sister's home with these bugs. My sister's husband is allergic and one time he stopped on the hospital because bed bugs. When we spoke about the problem, the receptionist told us the money will not be refunded because I did the pre paid payment. But I payed (Â£ 1200!!!) to receive a good service and above all safe. We call the health surveillance to check the place, but we didn't know what happened. After to lose one day of our vacation they just changed us of room. Now was the same I saw on the website. We bought insecticides and used every day. I didn't know this web site yet, if I knew I'd never booked this piggery!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: thisisnoteasy
Reviews.Content: I felt I had to put my views on here to counterbalance some of the negativity about this hotel! I booked this hotel on line without checking any reviews. Myself and three friends needed a good location for the Royal Albert Hall for 21st November and this was the nearest I could find at a price we could afford. It was with some trepidation that I had decided not to tell my friends the reviews I had read after I had made the booking. I was hopeful of at least clean sheets and after reading some of the reviews on here, I was left feelng we would be lucky if we even had a bed in the room. To my delight the hotel was clean and comfortable with immaculately clean bed linen and comfortable beds. The rooms were small but adequate for one or two nights. I was so relieved and I am glad that I didn't change the venue after these awful reviews - reviews which in my opinion are unfounded. The breakfast was very good with plenty of choice and we were able to linger and didn't feel hurried at all. We had the option of a cooked breakfast which looked delicious but we had ate so much that we didn't have room for anything else. We had two twin rooms, 101 and 105 - 101 was slightly more spacious but the bathroom was bigger in 105! I am glad I found this little gem and intend to stay there again on my next visit to London. The staff were courteous and helpful - from the reception area on arrival to the catering staff at breakfast. The only regret I have is not leaving a tip!

Reviews.Title: “Basic comfortable hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: Teresa J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night on the 7th November. The room itself was in the basement - small, clean and comfortable with small an en-suite and two single beds. What was good was having a plasma tv and tea, coffee facilities. The en-suite as I said was very small but adequate. What my friend and I didn't like however was the reception - when we checked in we were advised that the breakfast would cost x amount. We politely told the receptionist that our breakfast had already been paid when we made the booking. We were then told that we could only have the continental and that it had to be delivered to our room and we were to eat it there. We were told that we could not eat in the breakfast room as it would be too busy - this was in fact not true as the room in the morning was virtually empty. The hotel is in a good location - a quiet road just off Bays-water Road which runs alongside Hyde Park. It is only a 15 minute stroll to Oxford Street or buses are frequent.

Reviews.Title: “I Really Liked It”
Reviews.Author: dragon53
Reviews.Content: The room i had was large modern and spotless and the breakfast was good. This hotel does not deserve bad reviews. I had room 101 perhaps ask for that room .

Reviews.Title: “terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: G234
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, my partner and I were mortified. The hosts wernt friendly and the cleanliness was appauling. There was dust and grime everywhere and the room was filthy. The sheets didnt even look like they had been changed and I found hairs underneath the pillows. When we eventually went to sleep we were awoken to another guest entering out room at 2.30am. The hosts had given them the wrong key! When waking the next day there wasnt even basic essentials such as tea or milk which I found shocking, on this discovery we decided to go for breakfast which was included in the price of the room. When approaching the dining room it was apparent that there was only 20 or so tables for a hotel that has more then 300 guests. We waited for 35mins to be turned away because breakfast was finished. The stay at The duke of Leinster was dissapointing to say the least and I feel this ruined our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely time”
Reviews.Author: weirdo92
Reviews.Content: I just couldn't help myself but write a good review about this place after reading everything below! I stayed here together with two other people and we had a great time. Yes the rooms are pretty small, but they were clean and the beds were comfortable. Not sure about service since we never had any complaints so we never had to ask them for anything. We got clean towels every day, the staff seemed friendly and I think it was good value for the money we paid. Also the location was great, only two stops (underground) away from Bond Street. The breakfast was basic but it was good. Only con was that the breakfast room was quite small, so you might have to wait a couple of minutes before entering. However, it never took long so we didn't mind!

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel I have been in”
Reviews.Author: lulubaker64
Reviews.Content: This hotel was laden with bedbugs despite an overall tidy first impression and when i showed the bites to management, there was complete denial. We also noticed mattresses being hauled out of rooms on the same day as our complaint so probably other rooms were infested. The lack of any concern or responsibility was incredible! The staff, with the exception of a single person, were rude, unprofessional and cold. We had other problems such as the room being smaller than advertised, no soap for 2 days, trying to charge for breakfast that was already included in the price and no air conditioning in a very hot room. These now seem trivial compared to the bedbug infestation! We plan to sue for negligence.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: The Duke of Leinster Hotel was booked by myself and my family in good faith hoping for an enjoyable week-end break in London. Our week-end turned out to be one to forget however! We booked the hotel for 3 nights; -Night One Discovery Of BED BUGS in our room Soiled Bed Sheets No Air Conditioning Tiny Room Unsafe Electrics (Broken Kettle, Hairdryer, Etc.) Diabolical Staff No Communal Area -Night Two We had to leave the hotel and purchase another without any compensation. No taxi fairs refunded -Night Three Tired and distressed, we spent our final night in the Stansted Airport lobby Avoid the Duke Of Leinster at all costs, it's a health risk currently under investigation by The British Health Standards Association.

Reviews.Title: “'DUMP'”
Reviews.Author: debbie_blues
Reviews.Content: Would not advise anyone to stay in this hotel, we booked what we thought was a good flash deal on Booking.com which was 'Non Refundable' as me, my husband and the baby were only stopping over for two nights which turned out to be the worst weekend ever. I checked in with the baby whilst my husband went to park the car, as I walked in the first thing I noticed was how small the room was and could hear cars passing by even though I had requested a quiet room with a bath tub we were allocated the smallest room right on the street side with a shower and no bath. I went back to reception to complain but got a very unhelpful receptionist so was forced to go back to the room. My husband eventually came back and was so shocked to see what was' supposed to be a hotel' to be quite frank I'm not sure how this even managed to get a grading, whilst it appears to be a 4 star on some sites!! We found an old boot in the room and the shower itself was blocked so my husband had to wait a few hours for the water to drain so he could have a shower after travelling so far. Breakfast was horrible, we went out early in the morning to try and stay out of the hotel as possible and when we came back late afternoon our room was still not cleaned, we went to reception to find out why and they basically told us it depended how busy housekeeping was and basically was not guaranteed to be cleaned. Even though we'd fully paid for the two nights, late as it was and tired as we were we just could not stay any longer and decided to drive back home. WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME AND HAS DEFINITELY PUT US OFF LONDON

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ron188586
Reviews.Content: I have a serious complain about the Duke Of Leinster Hotel in London (20 Leinster Gardens, Bayswater , London, W2 3AN)! When we arrived Saturday (23/07/2011) at the hotel approx. 14:30 hrs the room was not ready yet, although according the information it should be at 14:00 hrs. We (my wife, 2 children 3 and 10 yrs old and me) had to wait for more than 30 minutes before the room got available. When we entered the room it smelled like somebody had used a toilet spray very heavily for hours. So, we had to open the window (there is no air-conditioning in the room). This was very dangerous with a 3 yrs old child, because the window was not secured and we were at level 5 (room 501). When opening the window my wife inhaled something awful. The first impression of the room was that it is much too small to for 4 persons. Because we were staying only for the weekend we left our luggage and went for sightseeing London. When we returned at 23:00 hrs the smell was almost gone, but then we discovered those animalsâ€¦ Hundreds of bugsâ€¦ Small ones, big ones, in our beds, in the curtains, everywhereâ€¦. We killed some big ones and carried them to the reception to ask what it was. The man couldnâ€™t answer that question. Because he was busy he told me that he will come up to check. He came half an hour later and was not able to identify what animals it was (language barrier maybe?). We asked for a solution, but he could give us one. He told us that he has to leave and hand it over to his colleague, the night porter. I went for a smoke, outside the hotel and an Irish man came to me and he told me that he had heard my story at the reception and told me that they have left the hotel the night before for the same reason. They were back at the hotel to claim their money back, but the story they heard that only the manager could do that. There was no sign of a manager at the hotel. I have asked to speak to the manager, but the night porter told me that he canâ€™t find him. I asked for the managerâ€™s telephone number; he refused to give me that number. The other man told me that these animals are so-called bed-bugs. We thought that some of those were young cockroaches. He told me that the same night they were leaving the hotel, 2 ladies came out of the elevator screaming and were scratching their heads, because these were full of animals. I donâ€™t know what happened to the ladies and what they decided (to leave the hotel or not)â€¦ After hearing these stories I decided to abandon the hotel, so I went up and told the family to pack our things and that we will move to another hotel. I went down to the receptionist to ask for booking another hotel for us. He was willing to help, but there was only one computer to do that and that computer was occupied by one of the guests, so he couldnâ€™t do anything for me. While talking to this guy he confirmed that I was not the first one who had this experience with this hotel; this was going on for days / weeks alreadyâ€¦ So in the middle of the night we had to move to another hotel (taxi Â£25)â€¦ I've sent the manager (LAURENT@cristalhotels.co.uk) an e-mail to get my money back. Until now I didn't receive any responds from him, nor my money.... My advice: DO NOT EVER BOOK THIS HOTEL!!! You will get unhappy and will loose your money

Reviews.Title: “Not fit for a night”
Reviews.Author: Eraikat
Reviews.Content: Prior to our arrival, we booked a quadruple/family room for six nights. We were told that there would be a double bed and two single beds. When we saw the room, we were shocked with its size; the room was at its best a twin room with a double bed, a single bed and a prop up "bed" that was no more than a flimsy frame with a paper-thin mattress. The bed could not support any application of weight without sinking into the floor. Due to the room's size and bed placement, the bathroom was almost impossible to access without climbing all over the beds -- that was something impossible for my wife who had suffered a broken leg. The sheets, cups and plates were filthy and the bathroom even worse. Most horrifying was the presence - and degree of such presence - of bed bugs in the room. We managed to catch a large number of them within minutes. When we presented them to the impotent reception staff, we were told that they could do noting about it. We asked to see the manager numerous times throughout the day but were told that we would not be could not during that day and that we would be able to the following morning (we staying in another hotel, at our expense, that night). That proved to be a false assurance and, the following morning, we were told that we still could not speak to him. The staff members, in general, were ridiculously rude, lethargic and apathetic. They would tell us that they could do nothing about our numerous complaints and that we would have to speak to the manager and then they would deny us permission to speak with said manager. We could not and did not stay a single night at the hotel and we feel absolutely cheated having paid for all the six nights we booked for. We've seen and stayed in hundreds of hotels all around the world yet we've never been this disgusted with any. It is uninhabitable.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, reception unhelpful & rude”
Reviews.Author: niawill22
Reviews.Content: I did'nt actually get to stay at this hotel!!!! I booked online through their own website had a confimation email for a triple room, when I arrived I was told by reception that my room was not booked. There was no real explaination as to why and it was very difficult to get much sense from the receptionist as her English was limited. When I showed her the email confirmation, she shrugged her shoulders & kept saying there is no room your room is occupied!!! I then demanded that she had to find us alternative accommodation to which she brushed off and pointed us to the internet point in the corner of reception to find our own accommodation. While panicking to find accommodation for three people anywhere in London on a Saturday, three other parties came into reception separately and had the exact same thing said to them. One of the parties that was staying for longer than one night had alternative accommodation provided. The rest was left in the same boat as us. We found reasonable accommodation at one of the Hiltonhotels mainly due to how late we was booking, however half the day had been wasted due to a mistake on the Duke of Leinster's behalf. One month later I was contacted by the Duke of Leinster's booking team claiming they had no recod of my party staying on the date I had booked and no cancellation.Thefore, they would be debiting my account with the price of the room!!! I replied with not a very friendly email stating all of the above to which I have heard no reply / apology and no debit card transation.

Reviews.Title: “INFESTED WITH BED BUGS - AVOID AT ALL COST!!!”
Reviews.Author: LDCJD
Reviews.Content: Checked in here given the limited availability in town that evening - will not be returning and would advise anyone to avoid it! Woken around midnight itching only to find when pulling covers back that the bed was INFESTED with bugs!!! Took two hours for them to find an alternative room at a different hotel which I was then charged Â£70 (in cash) for. Waititng to find out if I can get my money back but just keep away from this place!!!! Not a cheap room at Â£204 and how they keep their 4* rating I will never know.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: annemcc4
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights in party of 5 people..not a pleasent experience...2 rooms booked...booked triple room , but had double bed and 2 single beds, which made the room very limited for space....on 1st night discovered 3 lights and plugs not workin rang reception and was told some1 would b wit us shortly. had 2 ring again 40 minutes later. when staff arrived they were unable 2 sort problem !! 1st morning at breakfast was terrible, our party of 5 were spread over 3 tables, staff were very unfriendly and no-one seemed to know who was doin what. cooked breakfast was terrible and we just had toast...we complained at reception but again staff did not appear interested, we went to local pub next day and had a fanstasic cooked breakfast...this hotel is not worth the money and i would like to know how hotels earn their grading ?????

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: potnoodlegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the 20th-22nd May and were in room 503 which was small but very clean with a good shower and TV, comfortable bed. Unfortunately we only had one pillow each and were told there were no more so we just used the cushions as a second pillow. No street noise and they even provided a fan which was nice given there's no air con. Breakfast was fine, tea/coffee, juice, toast, pastries, cereal, yoghurt, even boiled eggs. Pleasantly surprised given the negative reviews on here!

Reviews.Title: “Awful / infested with bedbugs, no manager, had to find another hotel room at 1am!”
Reviews.Author: funkymunkyuk
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went to London for the night and booked the Duke of Leinster through Supabreaks. We were advised to park at their sister hotel The Edward which was 4 mins away. We arrived at Queensway tube station and had a bit of a problem finding the place. Anyway we found it and all was well, seemed nice in the reception area. Went upstairs to room 603 on one of the top floors. Carpets were ripped and a little shabby in the hallways. Got into the room and it was small but adequate on first glance. Got changed and headed out for some sights and a meal. We arrived back about 11pm and had a shower and settled down to watch tv. About half hour later we saw some bugs on the bed and put them out the window, no problems as it was a warm night. Anyway half hour later there were more bugs on the bed and lifted the pillow and there were about 20 something, we then lifted the mattress and it was infested! NO WAY WERE WE STAYING THE NIGHT IN THIS ROOM so my girlfriend went to reception to ask for another room. The man called Arash on reception said there were no rooms and there was nothing he could do, so my girlfriend came back. I went down myself and took a bug with me and the guy on reception basically said there was nothing he could do and the manager wont answer his phone. I said I would like a refund and we would go elsewhere even though it was 1am we couldnt stay as it was literally infested. He just said he couldn't and didn't seem bothered at all,didn't even have a look and the manager was not contactable and nobody was in charge?! We searched for an hour on the internet for any available rooms, bearing in mind it was 1am now and were quoted Â£120 + wherever we asked locally which was too much for us to afford.. When we left we took the receptionists name and the manages name so we could talk in the morning. Off we went at 1.15am on the streets of london with all out luggage, we could not drive home as we had a few drinks, but the tube was closed anyway! We eventually ended up at their sister hotel The Edward at Paddington and they gave us a room, albeit another Â£70 lighter. We woke up and went to the Leinster and asked to speak to Laurent or a duty manager but but were basically told to go away as there was nobody in charge on bank holiday? We then called Supabreaks who called the hotel and were told there were no managers on duty over bank hols and they would contact them separately. I am hoping to get a refund but we'll wait and see. I have stayed in hotels in Brazil, Cuba, Bogota, Egypt and never had these problems! If the situation gets sorted I will feel they have tried but no replies or result will be terrible.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is a location, nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Karuselli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on Christmas 2010. After 2 nights we noticed that all the beds were full of BEDBUGS!!! I went to reception and told about that. And what they said or did? The answer is: nothing. I had to told them what to do.. Like at first we need a new and clean room without bedbugs.. So we get another room, but there was not electricity. They fixed it. We wanted to talk to the manager, but it was really hard to catch him. He was very unpolite and acting it was our fault there were bedbugs. It wasnt big thing to him, but we donÂ´t want to gett those kind of souvenirs and itchy skin after bites. So never again and remember; always check under the mattress! Place can look tidy, but is not. Olimme joulun aikaan tÃ¤ssÃ¤ hotellissa. Hotellihuoneet nÃ¤yttÃ¤Ã¤ siistiltÃ¤, mutta eivÃ¤t ole. SÃ¤ngyt on tÃ¤ynnÃ¤ LUTIKOITA! En suosittele.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Duke if Leinster at a very affordable price”
Reviews.Author: fromOsloOslo Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: We are a couple with one teenager daughter. We stayed 4 nights at the Duke. The room was clean, nice and warm, the beds great, lots of hot water all the time, the TV was nice, the breakfast good, and the price cheap. Also, the location is very good. We were very pleasently supprised.

Reviews.Title: “Poor stay at the Duke of Leinster”
Reviews.Author: johnrivers2009
Reviews.Content: THE DUKE OF LEINSTER HOTEL. I booked this hotel for one night stay in london with my wife along with return train tickets for the 8th Dec, your booking reference 11795794. After seeing the show that we also booked at Queens Theatre we returned to the hotel, the room had no heating turned on and there was no milk to make us a cup of tea with. The room was very poorly cleaned and the tiled floor in the bathroom was loose and broken with a large area of tiles placed in and not fixed, this was dangerous you could not stand out of the shower with nothing on your feet for fear of cutting them. I went to reception to complain and ask for a different room but was told the hotel was full, and would have to take it up with the manager in the morning. In the morning i spoke of our problems to the receptionist who commented that she was unaware that the problems with this room had not been fixed. I could not belive that this hotel displaied AA four stars and demanded to speak to the manager. The manager refused to speak with me but after a long debate with the receptionst at the front desk i was offered a full refund. Since returning i have checked my bank statement i was given a full refund on the 9th of Dec only to have the full amount taken back out again on the 10th Dec. How can a hotel retake funds with out my permission!! I have contacted my bank and yourselves and also the hotel with no response, laterooms contacted the hotel on mybehalf and the hotel decided that the complaint was not justified.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mat2604
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location . Room was clean and staff are very friendly and helpful. Room nicely decorated with LCD TV but quiet small but it is normal for london. Could do with double glazed windown.

Reviews.Title: “Run as far as possible”
Reviews.Author: AJ61
Reviews.Content: Overbooking seems to be a routine. The rooms are awfully hot. If you have any problem don't worry, the manager will not even bother in talking to you, because he knows that you will never return there. Why would do ruin your trip again ? You can even have a surprise: you can return tired in the evening and discover that they changed your room !!!! That they moved your belongings from one room to another without any notice and threw your things that were on the shelf on the floor and clothes from the wardrobe on the bed (see photos) !!!! But don't worry, be happy, they will put your slippers and chocolate in the SAME bag ! If you enjoy meeting angry guests everyday, then it is a perfect place to stay. And if you think that the group "Crystal Hotels" will listen to you, another mistake, they don't care... So, RUN AS FAR AS POSSIBLE !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality and zero customer service for very expensive rate”
Reviews.Author: CstuartB
Reviews.Content: Booked double room, but when checked in, told, no double, only twins- take it or leave it. Room tiny in basement. Door would not even open halfway before hitting one of the beds. A horrible wet brown patch on the carpet floor next to shower room door, was not nice. Woken up at 4am with constant moving around/squeaky floor boards from either the reception area or another bedroom. Two attempts to get a manager to discuss-- nothing. Finally a dismissive e-mail. that when replied to, was ignored. Would NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: YngveGS
Reviews.Content: Decent location in London, posh neighbourhood and fairly close to the Tube. Very small rooms, narow hallways. And very noisy.. Ypu could hear everything that happened in the rooms nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: georgia5213
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our first visit to London thru a travel agent in Spain for 3 nights. What a disappointment this hotel is for our first visit to this wonderful city. The weather was very warm the afternoon we arrived. The front desk personnel was helpful but placed us in the smallest hotel room we have ever seen. It had a double bed wedged into the corner with about 2 feet at the end to store your luggage and a foot wide path to the bathroom. There was a desk with enough room for the chair but no room to move the chair It was on the main floor with a half a bay window looking out at scaffolding and temporary plywood. with some sort of small shelve for a teapot. All of this would have been very funny and good for a laugh but the air was extremely hot in the room. When I spoke the front desk receptionist, she said she could move us to the 4th floor but every floor we went up the rooms got hotter. Ater one night in this little room where we had to have the fan on the chair and the window open we moved to the 3rd floor the last 2 nights. The room was bigger but the TV was broken and was replaced by the very helpful front desk personnel. We stayed out late those nights to advoid the hot room, we would rather ride the tube than try to sleep in the hot hotel room. If we had known that the hotel was only air conditioned in the lobby we would have never booked this hotel. The breakfast was good but the basement room where they had the buffet was also very small and cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out, you might not get what you think.”
Reviews.Author: Soren58
Reviews.Content: We ordered a triple room in April and arrived in July 9th 10.00 am and our luggage were locked away until later, when the room was ready. We went back 10.00 pm and they led us know our room wasn't avaible. In stead we got a single room, very small but usable and a double room in the basement with no air, no space and a small window with 6 feet or more to the gorund level. We complained at once, but that was the only room we could get. Next morning we packed and wanted to check out if we didn't get our ordered room. Now thinks was okay. Minding the hotel as a 4 star hotel, we expected better rooms adn NOT a room, which was below one star. We discovered, as we were waiting in the reception room, that we were not the only ones and we believe the hotel is using this tactic on purpose. With other words, overbooking with the basement rooms in mind for the first night. Our complains at departure wasn't accepted, as they didn't know, we were not satisfied!!?? They will look at it later and we should hear from the hotel manager later on e-mail for an reduction. We never heard from them!

Reviews.Title: “Duke of a hotel it is not”
Reviews.Author: therevmom
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel through a reputable agency, but my confidence in that agency is diminished after this experience. Location: while this is close to two Tube stations, it is not easy to find. The street is a residential street of Georgian architecture where a number of the previous residences have been converted into hotels. The easiest approach is from the Queensway station, but no one tells you that. Directions we received from the front desk over the phone while standing at the Bayswater station took us way out of the way. It took a Bobby to send us to the correct place. We arrived very tired (from a very long walk of being lost), and the front desk was friendly and helpful. The elevator is frighteningly small. The steps are much easier. The corridors are less than 2.5 feet wide and very noisy with no natural light. The rooms have been created from subdividing the original flats. Our room was not much larger than the full sized bed. There was a window that was part of a bay window looking out over the main street. The division left just 1/3 of the original window with a shelf constructed beside it for the placement of a tea pot, etc, with a small "bar" refrigerator underneath. Immediately beside it was a wardrobe so you could barely find room to get to the window. There is not air conditioning, so the window being open is important. But it won't stay open without putting a book or something in the hinge. It does not help that there was scaffolding outside the window -- making it less than safe to leave it open. The television sits on top of the wardrobe, but frankly you are better off to open the wardrobe, remove the fan from within, put the TV into the wardrobe and the fan atop it. Otherwise you have no air. The shower is so small that a woman cannot shave her legs in there. The toilet is about impossible to get to flush. Breakfast had been paid for by our travel agency's fees, but it was not served at a time we could eat it since our tours began from Buckingham Palace Rd and we had to take the tube to get there. The evening staff did not know how to ask the kitchen staff to arrange for a take-away, and the morning staff told us to ask the evening staff. So we did not get the breakfast we had paid for. WiFi is available. That is the one plus of this location: we did not get charged for the WiFi service. Overall, this is an ok place if you're stuck, but I will not stay here again. It is not worth the cost of the room for a poor location and a closet sized room.

Reviews.Title: “What a disapointment, I would never book with this company again!”
Reviews.Author: sashaFifeScotland
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed to arrive at the hotel late afternoon after a six hour journey to be told that due to maintenance work the hotel could not accommodate us, we booked in November 2009 and our stay was in June 2010 so I felt they had had plenty of time to make us aware of this, instead we were told we would need to walk the route marked out on a map to the hotels sister hotel ten minutes walk away. I wasnâ€™t happy as there were no visible signs of any maintenance going on and other visitors were being checked in but as I didnâ€™t want to start our two night break with rows or waste what precious time we had, I checked that the sister hotel was of the same standard as the Duke Of Leinsters web page, "modern aristocratic style rooms" I was assured it was. Away we trundled and we eventually found the hotel, The Brunel, Well what can I say? Maybe net curtains from the 70's, blankets and a chintz throw on the bed and a bathroom that must have been upgraded in the 70's certainly not my idea of boutique! We were shoved up on the top floor which the lift did not go to and the accommodation honestly looked like poor staff quarters. I was so cross but it would of wasted one of our two nights stay if we had gone back to the original hotel, and the room was at least clean. The following morning I checked the room rates and The Duke of Leinster was Â£160 per night and the Brunel was Â£115 so they were not of the same standard. None of the reception staff could even smile at you let alone speak to you and when we checked out nobody asked us how our stay was they just took the room key and said bye, What a real disappointment, I would never book a hotel in the Crystal group again, I think that we got moved because we had got a cheaper deal as we booked early and they had since managed to book the rooms out at a higher price, but that is only my opinion. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Teased us”
Reviews.Author: catalan_girl
Reviews.Content: We went through venere.com. We changed the reservation and finally we have 3 double rooms. When we arrive they give us two simple rooms (one with one extra bed) and one triple room and we had to pay the price for the first reservation (more expensive). We had a discount through venere.com that they didn't apply. Nobody in the entire weekend could help us. We felt very helpless and it was an very unpleasant situation. After that we have complained and the manager has teased us.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say!”
Reviews.Author: Betsy5379
Reviews.Content: I booked a deluxe quad room for a 3 night stay in London. On arriving in this Hotel we were given a room with a double bed and a broken camp bed which blocked the wardrobe and the door to the bathroom! Natural we asked to be moved to a more suitable room which we had paid for and was told the hotel had been over booked (which happens regularly!) and we'd have to wait until the following morning! We asked to speak to the manager/supervisor but the receptionist was the only worker on duty and could do nothing for us. We were moved the following morning after an uncomfortable night for myself on the broken camp bed! On complaining to the manager regarding the poor service we received on our stay in his hotel, we found him to be rude and obnoxious and spoke to us, no sorry shouted at us like we were dirt that had blown off the street. He refused to listen to our geniune complaint and continuely flapped his hand at us as if dismissing us. We left the hotel very angry and very disappointed. The hotel is in a good location, but it is poorly run and the staff are just not performing a all round good job

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: tomas_1977
Reviews.Content: After making a reservation through booking.com we received confirmation by email. At the hotel receptionist told us they are overbooked and have no room available at the hotel (no sorry). Then sent us to Edward hotel (same owner) and promised its gonna be same standard as we paid for. We got 2 single rooms (paid for 1 double), 2 square metres each, big smell in the bath, dirty, noisy place, no one reacted to our complains at all. Do not book this or Edward hotel, itÂ´s disaster. Tomas, Czech republic

Reviews.Title: “I'm not sure where to begin with what is...”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaGrant
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where to begin with what is wrong with this hotel. Our 'Deluxe Quad Room' was approx 7ft x 10ft with one double bed and a camp bed! We had to climb over the camp bed to get to the double bed. We could not use the wardrobe as the door would not open due to aforementioned camp bed. There was no supervisor working during the weekend only a receptionist. When asked to be moved to a room that was better suited to the room we paid for we were advised that we would have to wait until the next day and even then it couldn't be guaranteed! Thoroughly disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Marli64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my teenage daughter for 4 nights on the ground floor (room 205) which was right behind the reception. So you did here some noise from there. Window looked out on a wall and there were lots of pigeons hiding there making a lot of noise in the morning and the window was full of bird droppings. Not a very nice site and not very hygienic. It was a small room with a double bed that was okay. Small bathroom but with good shower!! Unfortunately no wifi access in this room. Then my mother came and we moved to a triple room with 3 single beds (room 305). Right behind a fire door everyone had to go through so this made quite a bit of noise when people came in late or left early in the morning. Wifi access was good here. Bathroom was fine. Not a really large room but fine for the 3 of us for 3 nights. Reception area is small. It has a computer you can use. Breakfast room is really really small and if you are unlucky (we were once) you have to wait in a queue to get seated. Simple breakfast with rolls/croissants that aren't freshly baked. How difficult can it be to offer freshly baked bread??? They ran out of jam on Sunday and as Monday was Bank Holiday new jam didn't arrive until Thursday morning!!! I find this very bad. But if you look for a cheap hotel at a central location then this is a perfect hotel. I didn't expect much so it met my expectations. Shops, restaurants are nearby and Queensway and Bayswater Underground stations are at a 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Reallu good surprise”
Reviews.Author: PPX1974
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews I wasn't expecting a great hotel, just a place to rest after a busy day sightseeing. However I got really surprised with this one! Very clean, new interior, very friendly staff and nice breakfast, very nice room and bathroom. Excellent facilities, such as free wifi or a computer where you can access the Internet for free , complimentary water and tea coffee facilities as well as international newspaper. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very poor service and problems”
Reviews.Author: Jon1968
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is located in a great location in Westminster, just a stone's throw from public transportation, Hyde Park, etc. However, when we arrived, the water in our room was scalding hot (both shower and sink). Although it was repaired - somewhat - in about five hours, it still gave us problems throughout our 3 day/2 night stay. Also, when I asked for toilet paper (it wasn't replaced when the maid turned over the room) I was told I had to go to the basement and get it myself. Lastly, when we asked the front desk to call us a cab, only too late did we discover that the young lady working the front desk called one of her friends to pick us up in a van! We didn't realize until we got in that there was no meter and the driver had no idea how to get us to our destination (Soho) and eventually just dropped us off and told us to walk... after charging 20 pounds UK. I could deal with the tiny room, 12" tv screen, dirty walls, shaky/scary elevator, noisy neighbors, etc. but the above was too much. This is all inexcusable and I therefore rate this hotel 1/10 - very poor. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Modern Rooms, Lovely Breakfast - Would Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: emmm2003
Reviews.Content: We visited the Duke Of Leinster March 25th - 27th 2010. We travelled as a family of 3 female adults. We booked in advance so got a good rate for a triple room :-) First impressions were good, reception area is small but modern and clean. Check - in was quick (lady on reception not too friendly but did what was needed!). There is a lift which we used but it was very noisy and didn't feel too safe but didn't fancy walking 6 flights!!!! It was very small - 3/4 people max. Our room was nice and modern - spacious for us. We actually had a double bed and 2 singles which was perfect. There is a tv, tea/coffee facilities, hair dryer, mini bar in your room. You also have a fan which was great as the room was very warm! The bed were comfy and the room was clean! No noise heard at night from outside. There is a small bathroom but fully functional (however lock didn't work!). Shower is good! Pleased with the maid service too :-) I have to say how excellent the breakfast service is! We weren't expecting too much but was very impressed. Its only a small room approx 6/7 tables but staff were very friendly here. You can have mini boxs of cereal, bread rolls, toast, jams, fruit, youghurt and various croissants - very nice! There is tea/coffee/milk/orange juice. Was lovely :-) The location of the hotel is good - close to Queensway and Bayswater tube stations. We only really used the hotel as a base to see Sister Act (which is brilliant!) and Phantom of the opera. Its also good to visit Westfields Shopping Centre which is at white city tube station on the circle line. Upon check out (11am) the gentleman on reception was friendly - we used the luggage room too which is good. Any questions feel free to message me! but overall this is a good hotel and i would recommend it. It is very good value for money and perfect for a base to explore London! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the mishaps!”
Reviews.Author: GarSue
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four day mini break with my partner. The hotel was ideally loacted near 2 main tube stations of Bayswater and Paddington with numerous restaurants and bars within walking distance and Kensington park approx 5 mins walk. The hotel itself was clean and well presented. We stayed in a basement room which was very small but functionable, the toilet was broke and moved when you sat on it and a couple of lights did not work in the room either, Plus the bed was very uncomfy. We had breakfast included but i only had it one day as it was continental and you had to pay an additional Â£2.50 for a cooked english breakfast, whic was not explained to me on booking, My main issue with the Hotel really was the confusion with my booking, I originally booked with London Nights but did not receive any confirmation, i therefore telephoned the Hotels main booking line and asked about my reservation, I was informed no booking had been received but the room was still available and they booked it for me and ensured me there was definetly no other booking. On arrival at the Hotel i was informed they had 2 bookings for myself one from london nights and the other from the hotels booking agency which i think are called crystal, the receptionist then informed me i would have to pay for one additional night due to the error. I expalined the situation and asked to speak to the manager whom i was told would be available in the morning, i also explained they had all my contact details including my mobile and email and that if their was any confusion over the booking why had'nt clarification been sought? I was unable to speak to the manager for my whole trip as they were unavailable. I checked out on thursday and nothing further was mentioned. When i checked my bank this morning a payment for one additional night has been taken from my bank account without my authorisation. My other half and me are now dealing with this. I thouroughly enjoyed our trip and now feel this has darkened it slightly and unnessasary as with adequate communication between booking agents this could have been avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rude receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: Zarah123
Reviews.Content: I had requested a room high up in the building and was placed on floor 1 - which was in the BASEMENT!!! A small, dirty room with a small window towards a wall. We talked to the receptionist and she said the hotel was fully booked, exept for single- and quadruple rooms. We could change room the next day "if we had to" and the next morning we talked to the receptionist about this. After sighing she agreed to give us another room, if we could be there at 11 oÂ´clock. We told her we had reservation at Mme Tusseaud's at 10.30 and wouldn't be able to be back at 11. She told us that SHE (that was pregnant) would absolutely not move our bags to the other room. We told her that we didn't expect her to move our bags, maybe the maid could put it in our room - we would be happy to pay her to do it (we had two small bags that weighed not more than 5 kg each). At last we got our new room, at 4th floor, in the corner and it was perfect with large windows and clean bathroom. The receptionist told us the standard is the same for the rooms in the basement vs higher up but this was a lie! The only problem with the new room was that it was so cold we had to sleep with clothes on!! But rather that, than staying in the awful room in the basement! The breakfast was great and the staff there was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: badangie26
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend staying in this hotel! On our reservation we specifically asked for a room with 2 beds and were told that it would be no problem. After checking in and going to our room in the BASEMENT of the hotel we discovered only 1 full size bed and barely room to move around in the room. The carpet was stained and extremely dirty, coming up around the edges and was very loose. It was a hazard plain and simple. We walked back up to the desk and explained to them that we had requested a room with 2 beds and that the room was disgusting. They said sorry we are all booked up, but you can look at this other room and see if you like it better. The only better thing about the other room, that was still in the basement, was that it had a little more room for movement. The hotel was extremely LOUD with staff talking in the hallway and staff slamming doors and whatnot. Our room was hot and the window did not even crack open. There is very little lighting in the room. We requested a late checkout (12) and were told that it would not be a problem. Checkout is normally at 11am. Promptly at 1055 we were called and told that we needed to be checked out of the room by 11!!! The staff was very rude our entire stay and the rooms were gross. I would NOT recommend this hotel to my worst enemy! OH and the wi-fi was not working and the 1 computer provided for internet access was broken!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Jmm10
Reviews.Content: I can't say much about this hotel to be honest. Stayed for only one night, so was only there to sleep literally - didn't even have breakfast. (was visiting my aunt - she was there for 4 night and really liked it). Our room (twin room, me and a friend) was ok - a bit small, but ok. The elevator is hilarious!! Soooo small!! I actually thought it was quite funny! Took a bunch of pics inside.. If you are claustrofobic there is no way your getting near that elevator! Location is really good! Near the tube and bus stops - and Hyde Park just a few steps away!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in London”
Reviews.Author: besugo
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time in London. All the other three times I stayed at awful hotels... usually old, smelly, and some of them very noisy, with cleaning problems, poor breakfasts and unfriendly staff. So, this time I wasn't expecting a great hotel, just a place to sleep and have a shower in the morning. However I got really surprised with this one! Very clean, new interior, no bad smells, very friendly staff and nice breakfast, very nice room and bathroom. Besides, it has several facilities, such as a computer where you can acess the Internet for free (or you can pay a fee for using wireless access) or everything you need to make tea inside your bedroom, for free! The only thing I'd call a problem is that you have to walk between 5 and 10 minutes to get to the closest underground station. But that was not a problem for me and once you get to the undergound you are close to every London spot :) I would call this a bargain, since I went with 2 friends, and we paid 195â‚¬ for 2 nights + 2 breakfasts, that's just 32.5â‚¬/night/person!. Anyway, I got this price in a travel agency. The price in the reception was twice what we paid...

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Connie19
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Duke of Leinster Hotel. Found hotel quite good. But on arrival we had asked for a Twin Room - but were told not one available. I was very dissappointed in this as I was travelling with my daughter - but stayled as I was tired and hot and could not be bothered looking for another hotel. Otherwise this was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again is too soon.”
Reviews.Author: manitou2
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is the hotel next door, which we moved to after two nights at this debacle of a hotel. The public rooms are lovely, which belies the horror story behind the scenes, which is sadly the substance of this hotel. Location was the reason we chose it. I wish we had foresight before spending the money on this dump. Towels full of holes, and very grimy.Hotel floor was dirty. Shower was useless, as the water was almost cold. TV didn't work. Windows wouldn't open. Staff - who knows. We complained, but they just did nothing. We asked if we could change rooms but that couldn't be arranged.

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: lillylemon
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a triple room with 3 single beds and the room was lovely. Clean and plenty large enough for what we wanted. 10 minute walk from Paddington station, 5 minute walk from queensway and bayswater underground stations so easy to get almost anywhere in London via the underground and just 2 minutes walk from Kensington park. We did not have breakfast but there are many places to eat within a 10/15 minute walk. I will definatly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best bit was leaving!”
Reviews.Author: it_traveller2009
Reviews.Content: I booked a "Deluxe Double" to be informed when I arrived that the hotel didn't have any deluxe doubles and i was in fact getting "a double for single occupancy" which translated means a double bed in a room barely big enough for a single. The door hardly locked being secured by a cheap yale lock. The shower tray had insects crawling in it, the tiles were cracked, the toilet roll holder fell off the wall, the safe didn't work, the tv didn't work properly...... This was my first five minutes..... On complaining, i was informed that they couldn't move me as housekeeping had already gone home. I was also asked to leave my key at reception whenever I left the hotel (which I declined to do) On leaving, I found that i was covered in insect bites! A benefit I can live without.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, clean, 7 blocks to tube”
Reviews.Author: gigicleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: located between the Bayswater and Queensway tube stations; hotel was clean and nice; good breakfast (make sure you verify that it is included, even though my travel agent had it in writing, they still turned my children away from the breakfast and said it was not supposed to be included for my price - i told them it was, they called travel agent and let us eat, but tried to add extra to the bill) front desk at night was really friendly and helpful, a French girl, the day desk, not as helpful or friendly. rooms small, but clean, own bathrooms, put our rooms near each other; call a black cab, the one the hotel recommended was scary and tried to cheat us (they said they would not refer him again); cabbie also tried to have us walk to an ATM at night with him, would not take credit after hotel negotiated this with him; hotel intervened for us; not a bad walk to tubes, felt safe even at night. nice and clean. if you've never been to london, no hotel is right in the middle of everything, you need to tube everywhere and it is great; buy an oyster card at the airport and load it with 15 euros or so, and the tube is 3 minutes between runs, don't crowd into a full train, just wait 3 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed our stay, staff were pleasant and the room was nice”
Reviews.Author: J1984
Reviews.Content: me & my partner stayed in this hotel whilst in london sightseeing, it made a great base being just round the corner from a tube station on the central line. the hotel was clean and the staff were pleasant if a bit vague at times. it did seem that the hotel mainly had international guests and all european staff. but everyone was friendly and we found them to be willing to help. the room was simple but adequate, and met all of our needs. we enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recomend this hotel to others if theyre wanting a base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: minutoshi
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed at the hotel for 3 days in one of the family rooms. I was definitely not expecting such a generously sized room especially in London at that price. It was a room large enough to fit 4 people comfortably, a small table with chairs. The shower and toilet was small but overall we were very happy. There were a few cracks in the walls with watermarks that required work. The tea cups were covered in dust to my horror but otherwise the level of cleanliness was acceptable. The location of the hotel was fantastic. It was only a stonethrow away from Queensway and Baywater station. There was a bus-stop nearby that had straight buses to Victoria station and the major shopping streets. The hotel was situated on a quiet street with lots of other hotels and therefore safe to walk at night and also not much traffic. There were lots of good eating spots in Baywater. Internet was not available in the rooms but there is an internet cafe close by. Overall, for the price, it went above my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Stay..”
Reviews.Author: Schmikkles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 2 night stay at the Duke of Leinster for a 3 day sightseeing break in September 2008. We booked online and only paid a deposit of around Â£11 before our trip. The balance was payable on check-in with any extras paid for on check-out. We received a substantial discount booking on line. We arrived using the London Underground, the closest station being Bayswater. The hotel is a pleasant 10 minute walk from Bayswater, through the popular shopping district of Queensway. The reception staff were polite, well dressed and the reception was spotless. The receptionist was helpful and we were given the option to change our room for another if not acceptable. We used the lift (tiny - use the stairs if claustrophobic!) and got to our 4th floor room, with a nice view onto Leinster Terrace/Gardens. The room was spotlessly clean, if a little compact, with a clean if slightly shabby en-suite shower room/toilet. The room contained a mini-bar, which proved useful for use as a fridge. Please note that the hotel is NOT licenced for alcohol, so the mini-bar only contained water and soft drinks. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided but we didn't get round to using them! A fan and a free-to-use safe were also provided. Breakfast was Â£5 each for unlimited continental or Â£7.50 for unlimited continental and a full cooked breakfast. On both occasions we opted for continental only, which proved to be most sufficient, with tea, coffe, juices, fresh fruit, yoghurts, toast, danish pastries, croissants, cereals, boiled eggs, cheese, crusty bread rolls and preserves. There was an excellent selection and was well worth the money. The breakfast staff were also excellent. One evening, we booked a taxi through reception. The taxi turned up promptly and turned out to be a chauffeur driven 'S' class Merecedes with full cream leather and blacke out windows. Prices were also comparable to 'black cab' charges, so I recommend booking taxis at the hotel if at all possible. The chauffeur was polite and referred to me as 'Sir', which was a nice touch. On check-out, we were alllowed to leave our luggae in a safe place for the remainder of the day at no extra charge. The hotel staff were polite and attentive throughout our stay. In summary, a great hotel for a short stay. Rooms a little small but not cramped. Excellent reception service and breakfats. Not too far from a tube station. Lots of local cafes/restaurants/shops if you fancy a quiet one..

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: AndreyM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days and must say that I'm satisfied. + good staff + good location (1st tube zone an 400m to Queensway station) + clean room + value for money + tea coffee and wifi in room - breakfast doesn't worth 10$ better to go outside - tiny rooms (for me ok) - ground floor a bit noisy - no hair dryer My conclusion I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small Cramped Room”
Reviews.Author: TheWyattses
Reviews.Content: Our double bedroom was behind reception on the ground floor facing onto the road. It was tiny, my Husaband had to climb over me to get in and out of bed and we could not see the TV because it was in a wall cabinet diagonally opposite where the bed was. We were there for 3 nights and each morning awoke to find a bag of towels outside our room, this was the only attempt at valeting the room. We have just had a look at some of the photos with other reviews and realised the room we stayed in carried a review for a single room........We booked the room through Hotelopia 10 weeks before, however, they cancelled our booking at this hotel 36 hours before our arrival and had to re-instate our booking when we refused their alternatives, perhaps this was the reason we were given a single room being sold as a double, but it does not excuse the lack of cleaning or topping up the toiletries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Our room very nice, BUT”
Reviews.Author: KeenJean
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb location, many eating places nearby and Whiteleys Shopping Centre. Our room was 304, excellent position with 3 opening windows, a bit noisy at night outside but thats London. After using my Visa card here (when it was momentarily taken out of my sight) I suspect, but not sure that, my details were passed on. I had a few transactions not mine 2 days later. Be careful in London with your credit card details!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Couple-of-Kiwis
Reviews.Content: The Hotels loaction was barely Ok, close to Paddington and hence the trains from Heathrow but that is about all that was OK. The room was small, strangely shapped with a very small window looking onto a light well so that the room was dark and unpleasent. The floor slopped so that the bed was on a lean. Fortunately we only booked for 1 night otherwise I think we would have moved

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYNY2000
Reviews.Content: This is a decent no frills hotel. The single room was basic but bigger than others I've had in London. The furniture was inexpensive looking, but clean and functional. Bathroom was small, but new and very clean. Staff were very helpful! The lift was very small but worked. My room was had a nice view! The tube was not too close but not too far either. Good neighborhood, seemed safe. Only complaints: the fridge in the room didn't work and the decorative pillows on the bed looked old and shabby - yuck! Otherwise, I'd say if you're looking for inexpensive, no frills, safe place this is a good choice. I'd try it again!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug102
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Duke of Leinster. Since we booked through Expedia and got the place for practically free, we knew they would give us a sucky room and we were right. We were put in the basement. This room was a second one we were given after the first one was totally unacceptable...a single so small we could not both stand in the room at the same time. There is a lift, but they had some pipes burst before we came and there was sewage pouring out over it...you could hear/smell it from the lobby. That was fixed within the day, however. The Pros: The room, the bathroom and the hotel in general was quite clean. The front desk staff were pleasant, and the location was very good, on a mostly quiet street but very near two Tube stations and Queensway, which has a ton of shops, banks and restaurants/pubs. There was a good fan in the room that cooled it down well since it was so stuffy. There was a minibar but the fridge was set pretty low, the stuff inside wasn't very cold. The Cons: The hotel would not honor our free breakfast, telling us Expedia "just tells people they get it but they really don't." The beds were excruciating...no support whatsoever. Our backs were aching every morning. (We could have dealt with all the negatives, which were just laughable, if the beds were better.) Our window was tiny and had a view of a wall, some pipes and garbage on the ground. They tried to charge us for the minibar, which we didn't use at all. Luckily, they didn't give us any grief when we refused to pay. We both have stayed in many London hotels and this one was about the same as the others and we weren't expecting much. Even though we rarely spent any time in the room, the most important thing to us...the beds... were so bad, I could not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: AveEva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. Overall we had a very pleasent stay. Yes, the room was small. But thats London so you can't really complain about that. It was very clean en comfortable. The bathroom was quite new en very nice. Privet safe in our room. Breakfast was good, lots to choose from and great service. The staff was helpfull and polite. Although they couldn't answer all of our questions (travel and the city). It's a good hotel, you definitly get what you pay for. I would recommend this hotel to tourists. I would go here again.

Reviews.Title: “disaster of a room”
Reviews.Author: gourmet2go
Reviews.Content: The Duke of Leinster might turn out to be average on another occasion, but for me on my first try it was terrible. Reason being they gave me a room in the basement that was too hot. While it was sort of cool outside, this room lacked decent ventilation, and it was a miserable two nights. I might try it again to see if another room is better, but the rest of the hotel experience was only average, and I think there are better places to stay in the area. Location is wonderful, and convenient to Paddington (Heathrow Expres). My plane landed at 9:30 PM and I was at the hotel by 10:30 and in a restaurant by 10:45.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Hotel, but staff very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: No_Name20L
Reviews.Content: This is a very plain hotel, but the staff are incredibly accommodating. I arrived in the early morning, having traveled for 24 hours from Asia. Even though my room was not available, they let me shower and change. I had an enjoyable stay at this hotel. The location is excellent. The hotel is within walking distance of Paddington Station, which is where the express train from Heathrow arrives. The parks are readily accessible and there is nightlife a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: amcsocal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke of Leinster for 3 nights at the end of Sept. The best part of this hotel is the location. It's located in Bayswater, close to a variety of restaurants, souvenir shops, and there's an indoor mall closeby. It's also close to Notting Hill, Hyde Park and Kensington Palace. The subway stop is within walking distance from the hotel, and there are a couple of city tour bus stops nearby so it was easy to catch the double decker city bus tours. This was my 2nd visit to London. When we last time, we previously stayed in Earl's Court, and between the 2 locations, the Bayswater location was the better one. For our stay at the Duke of Leinster, we booked a triple room. Probably not a good idea, as the room was very small. My small office here at work is bigger compared to our room itself. The bathroom space was also very small. Not much closet space. We were given a room on the 6th floor. As we visited London end of Sept, the weather felt like the first weeks of Dec in California, and you get a nice/cool breeze when you leave your windows open. The only thing each late night, you do hear some yelling outside (probably by people leaving the bars) if you leave your windows open. It doesn't have any A/C, so it probably would be very hot to stay during the summer as the previous reviewers noted. The Elevator was very small. If you had suitcases, only 1 person at a time can fit inside, even though we were all thin. As you were taken up, you can hear screeching sounds. You get used to it, but the first flight up could be a little scary being inside a small and old elevator. Breakfast was good for a light meal before heading out to explore London. The staff though were all very friendly. None of them were British, I believe they were Eastern European, but they were all great and helpful. The only problem one morning, a bunch of drunken guys for some reason had access to our room and opened our door. Luckily the 2nd lock was working so they couldn't really get in. We reported this to the front desk immediately and it was all taken care of and we were given new keys right away. For a while though, I had doubts with security of our hotel room, but everything was okay after that incident. In my opinion, it was a good 2 star budget hotel, which we paid about $140/night for the triple room. It was a good base for our 3 nights in London. But I think for next time, there's a lot of hotels in Bayswater that's worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlanRC
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights during a heat wave and there was no AC which made it difficult to sleep. Our compact room was on the ground floor so we also had to content with road noise and some boisterous young people late at night. Still, the location was good, the staff very helpful and our room was ready when we arrived early. Probably would stay here again. Comments from other reviewers matched our experience. One point (and the reason for this review): The Malaysian restuarant across the street (Lagenda) is excellent. Definitely give it a visit if you like food from SE Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Overall A Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Duke Of Leinster for 8 nights in June. The first night we were put into a room little bigger than a closet, in which there was no storage, and access to the bathroom was difficult without tripping or climbing over the bed. But happily when the following morning we asked for a larger room given our lengthy stay, we were graciously upgraded at no extra cost into a much bigger room. The continental breakfast was wonderful, though it would have been nice if the yoghurt and milk would have been kept cold. The neighborhood is basic London, nothing special, but relatively quiet, and it is just a short walk to Kensington Park and to Queensway Road. Two tube stations (Bayswater on Circle Line, & Queensway on Central) are within an easy 5 minute walk. Paddington Station is an easy 7-10 minute walk. The rooms were clean, the daily service was thorough, and the staff throughout the hotel were always pleasant and helpful. There is no WiFi or Internet access, except for the lobby computer which charged an outrageous 6 GBP for 15 minute's use. The shopping center (Whitbey's, I believe it was called) a short distance away on Queensway had computers you could use for a more reasonable rate of 2 pounds for 2 hours. The only other complaint about the hotel was that no recycling was offered, even though there is presently a big push in London for residents to recycle more. All in all, if you just want a good home base hotel with nothing fancy but in a good neighborhood with easy access to tube stations and a variety of restaurants and grocers, the DofL is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “location excellent rooms basic what more do you want for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ReginaFillangie
Reviews.Content: I'm a Brit living overseas back in London for just a few days, needed only a place to rest. Had read mixed reviews on this site but know enough about most hotels in London that unless your willing to pay in excess of 300 quid a night, its much of a muchness in terms of quality and service. I was pleasantly surprised by the Duke - the staff whilst none of them were English were extremely helpful and friendly. The free breakfast is plentiful and in nice surroundings.
